contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox South African town |censuscode = 41810 |ref = <ref name="census2001">[http://census.adrianfrith.com/place/41810 Census 2001 â€” Statistics for Main Place]</ref> |name = Vredefort |settlement_type = |image_skyline = |imagesize = |image_caption = |image_map = |image_shield = Vredefort wapen.png |mapsize = |map_caption = |image_map1 = |mapsize1 = |map_caption1 = |pushpin_map = |pushpin_label_position = |pushpin_map_caption = Location in the Free State |pushpin_mapsize = |subdivision_type = Country |subdivision_name = {{flag|South Africa}} |subdivision_type1 = [[Provinces of South Africa|Province]] |subdivision_name1 = [[Free State (South African province)|Free State]] |subdivision_type2 = |subdivision_name2 = |subdivision_type3 = |subdivision_name3 = |government_footnotes = |government_type = |leader_party = |leader_title = |leader_name = | established_title = Established | established_date = 1878<ref name=established>{{cite web|title=Chronological order of town establishment in South Africa based on Floyd (1960:20-26)|url=http://upetd.up.ac.za/thesis/available/etd-07212011-123414/unrestricted/05back.pdf|pages=xlv-lii}}</ref> |area_total_km2 = |elevation_m = |population_as_of = |population_footnotes = |population_total = |population_density_km2 = |timezone=[[South Africa Standard Time|SAST]] |utc_offset=+2 |coordinates_display = display=inline,title |latd=27|latm=01 |lats=|latNS=S |longd=27 |longm=23 |longs= |longEW=E |postal_code_type = Postal code |postal_code = 9595 |area_code = 056 |website = |footnotes = }} '''Vredefort''' is a small farming town in the [[Free State (South African province)|Free State]] province of [[South Africa]] with [[cattle]], [[peanut]]s, [[sorghum]], [[sunflowers]] and [[maize]] being farmed. It is home to 3,000 residents. The town was established in 1876 on a farm called Visgat, on the [[Vredefort crater]], the largest and oldest visible [[bolide]] [[impact crater]] in the world (with a diameter of {{convert|300|km|mi}}). It was this approximately {{convert|10|km|mi|adj=on}} wide bolide that led to the preservation of the [[gold]]-bearing reefs of the Free State some 2.02 billion years ago. The town got its name after the peaceful conclusion of a threatened war between the [[South African Republic|Transvaal]] and the [[Orange Free State]]. The British built a [[concentration camp]] here during the [[Second Boer War]] to house [[Boer]] women and children. The Vredefort Dome (Crater) is currently the largest and one of the oldest known meteor impact site in the world.<ref>[http://www.unb.ca/passc/ImpactDatabase/CIDiameterSort2.htm Earth Impact Database]</ref> It is South Africa's seventh World Heritage Site and its status is largely due to the efforts of research scientists from Wits University, including Dr. Rodger Hart{{Citation needed|date=February 2013}}. ==See also== *[[Vredefort crater]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.parys.co.za Parys on the Vaal] * [http://www.islandestate.co.za Vaal de Grace Estate] [[Category:Populated places in the Fezile Dabi District Municipality]] [[Category:Second Boer War concentration camps]] [[Category:Populated places established in 1878]] {{FreeState-geo-stub}}
